improvement_list.improvement_desc: The `key` function in `sorted` might raise a `ZeroDivisionError` if any `weights[i]` is zero.  Add a check to handle this case.  Also, it is generally good practice to validate input lists to ensure that they are of the same length and that weights are all non-negative.
The variable `capacity` is declared as a list, but it's used as a scalar integer in the knapsack function. This is a type mismatch. Change `capacity` declaration to `int`.
The function `knapsack` is called with a list (capacity) instead of an integer. This will cause a runtime error in `cap -= weights[i]` since `cap` is of type float and `weights[i]` is of type float.
